May Issue of "Juche Idea" Published in Japan 
    Pyongyang, May 10 (KCNA) -- The May issue of "Juche Idea," the organ of the National Liaison Council of Japan Societies for the Study of Works of Kim
Jong Il, has been brought out.
 The paper carries on its front page a report that delegations of Juche idea study organizations from different countries visited the Kumsusan Memorial Palace and paid homage to President Kim Il Sung on the Day of the Sun.    
 Also carried in the paper are reports that Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met and talked with the director-general of the International Institute of the Juche Idea and heads of delegations and that members of the delegations participated in the celebrations and expressed their resolution to assiduously study the Juche idea and invigorate the movement for independence and peace in solidarity with the DPRK.    
 The paper devotes its second page to a photo-accompanied account of a gathering for celebrating the 80th birthday of Shuhachi Inoue, honorary director-general of the IIJI, and says that the honorary director-general and participants of the gathering vowed to live as required by the Juche idea and intensify the study and dissemination of the idea.
 Appearing on the third page are articles titled "We Advise the State to Make Apology and Compensation" and "Movement Demanding Post-war Compensation Gains Momentum", on the fourth page an article headlined "For True Friendship with Asian Nations" and on the fifth page news that a report under the title "Establishment of Normal Diplomatic Ties between Japan and the DPRK is the Only Way to Peace" was made at a study meeting sponsored by the Society of Visitors to the DPRK in Fukushima.
